sources.title: Corsair
sources.description: http://imdb.com/title/tt0021764/ Chester Morris, college football hero, gets a job on Wall Street for Thelma Todd's father. Fed up with the cons and piracy of Wall Street, he goes into business for himself, highjacking rumrunners' ships bound to Prohibition America. Delightful film with lots of plot twists and turns. Director Roland West's last film, after which he planned to spend the rest of his life with the soon-to-be-murdered Todd.

sources.title: Corsair (1931) THELMA TODD
sources.description:
Stars: Chester Morris, Thelma Todd, Fred Kohler 
 Director: Roland West

 A stock market broker plans to liven up his boring life by taking up piracy on the high seas.

sources.title: Corsair 1931 Colorized
sources.description: Entertaining comedy-drama about a bored young stockbroker who decides to give it up and become a pirate. Stars a great cast for those who love early movies: Chester Morris ('Boston Blackie'), Thelma Todd (billed as 'Alison Loyd' here), Mayo Methot (ex-wife of Humphrey Bogart), delightfully grouchy Ned Sparks, and wonderfully silly William Austin. Includes what is probably Ned Sparks's only kissing scene! Colorized using DeOldify technology. IMDB page: https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0021764 (Note: Although this movie is public domain, the colorization is copyright by me. My colorized movies are freely uploaded for free personal use. Please don't put them on your own YouTube channel and monetize them. Thanks.)

metadata.Plot: A stockbroker plans to liven up his boring life by taking up piracy on the high seas.
metadata.Writer: Walton Green, Roland West, Josephine Lovett
metadata.Actors: Chester Morris, Thelma Todd, Fred Kohler
